revert, stateless capitalism is not "pure capitalism"
"absolute form" is not POV. See talk. Many don't think capitalism has existed period, much less existed without government.
"absolute form" is POV because it assumes that capitalism does not involve the state on an integral level, since capitalism has never existed in the absence of the state this is questionable
I don't think "most closely" is their position, but that capitalism actually embraces the view
clarifying that anarcho-capitalists refer to the "free market" definition of capitalism
an anarcho-capitalism doesn't necessarily "voice" anything
"absolute form" not POV. There are ideals and there are real word approximations of these ideals. For example, a "free market" usually refers to a relatively free market than an absolutely free one.
